title: MPs from Punjab, Balochistan meet PM; discuss development works
content:
ISLAMABAD, May 28 (APP): Members of the National Assembly from Punjab and Balochistan Friday called on Prime Minister Imran Khan here and discussed the matters pertaining to development works in their respective constituencies.
Among those who called on the prime minister from Punjab included MNA Shaukat Ali Bhatti, former MP Mahdi Hassan Bhatti and MPA Khalid Gujjar.
During the meeting, they apprised the prime minister of ongoing development projects in Hafizabad and Raiwind.
MNA Nasrullah Dareshak and Ali Raza Dareshak also separately met the prime minister and discussed the positive impacts of the measures taken by the government for uplift of South Punjab and development projects in their respective constituencies.
Meanwhile, the MNAs form Balochistan including Muhammad Khan Jamali and Munawara Bibi Baloch also met the prime minister and deliberated over the massive scale development being carried out as part of government’s special attention towards province’s uplift.
Special Assistant to PM on Political Affairs and Chief Whip Amir Dogar also attended the said meetings.
